intro: Peucedanum arenarium, commonly known as desert cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale blue flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Peucedanum arenarium is often found in rocky habitats and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
